title: Permanent Autofill...
body: I understand you (riot) have tried to shorten queue times by adding autofill into the game, however having it on permanently in low elo is just ridiculous. The queue times have gone from 2-minute wait to 1 minute and I have been put in support and adc 7/10 games. The queue time hasn't even been shortened it has been lengthened because people continue to dodge every champ select. I understand that autofill is good when the server population is low but permanent auto fill really..... might as well just give us the old champ select again.

replies.body:
Once you've been Auto Filled once, or playing Support once your next three games you are guaranteed to get one of your picks.

There is no "permanent" auto-fill.

Hell I NEVER get auto-fill.

When making this post I was unaware of the auto fill protection, however, the champ select we had before the new one we got support about 10% of games this feels like we get it much more. The point I was trying to make is that I feel like the old champ select with the pick order was much more effective than the auto fill system
No, the old system of pick order was absolutely horrendous, and caused far too many issues.

Auto-fill has been on for the last few days or so. Usually, it's on for a day, then the notification goes away. It is permanent in that, after almost a week, the notification is still there. Autofill gets temporarily disabled when you play Support, yes, but the fact remains it's not going away, everyone has auto-fill enabled in low Elo, I myself have to deal with it in normals.
As I've said, I've never been auto-filled, never had to deal with auto-fill and I'm only in Silver.

_It also has something to do with the season we are currently in. _

* It's summer time, so a lot of people are going to be ditching video games in exchange for going out into the sun.  A lot of players will also be going on holidays to the beach, where they can't play games.
* We're also near the end of exam season (at least for NZ), where people are going to be studying instead of playing video games. 
* On top of this, its also preseason, where a good portion of your usual ranked players are playing norms and trying new stuff. 

All of this lowers your player pool, causing matchmaking issues and resulting the the need of autofill. Especially since a lot of players are only "mid/top" players and hardly any of the community supports. 

A good thing to do is to perhaps alternate between picking support as your primary (filthy and unthinkable, I know), picking up a super cool champ and playing them as support (poppy and irelia are pretty good at this, so is annie). That way, you play 1 game as a support, then 1-3 games as one of your main roles. 

Just like Klavinmour, I have only been autofilled once during my "hurr durr imma main top/adc and get out of this plat elo hell" 2day spree where I then gave up because I realised I am not good at CS. During my support main times, never ever autofilled even before you were autofill protected by playing sup.

>It's summer time, so a lot of people are going to be ditching video games in exchange for going out into the sun. A lot of players will also be going on holidays to the beach, where they can't play games.

Are you kidding me. They are gamers.

The only change is A/C will be on and they will be drinking more.

The only forseeable change to drop in players is the season hasn't started yet (well does today) otherwise summer changes crap all.

A good portion of our "gamers" are also school children who are forced on family holidays, as well as university students that know that they need to put aside the games and study for a better future during these times. 

Its also the time when a lot of these "gamers" will be heading into summer work at times where they previously would have been playing games. Gotta earn that money for next semester (and to buy RP obvs)

I'm not sure if you know the people who play this or you are reflecting your own life onto others but seriously most of he semi-casual and hard core players don't have that thought pattern at all. More time for gaming the better for them, even if they have school it comes second to the game or gaming.

Gamers who need escape will always take this game or others over finishing school work and will procrastinate until the end where they have to rush out their school work. I mean that's where the whole meme for it comes from, primarily from gamers or fanbois of certain things. 

Also summer work? Wtf is that. Are you American or something? Because summer here isn't like over in America at all. Our summer break is pretty short so most likely they use it to game the most or some times rarely go to family things. Very rarely would  they use that time to go overseas or to vacation, Vacation to them is being lazy and getting in some quality gaming time, if they don't think this way you can for sure tell they aren't a gamer or as we call them, tourist gamers. The only time i think people would go on holidays/vacation else where from home is kids forced to go with their parents. Ask any gamer teen and they would tell you their ideal holiday is spending more time with the games they love and not feeling bad about it one bit.
Four games with me filling so far in ranked flex new season, got adc three times, and support once. Interesting. Last season it was support 90% of the time, top 5%, adc 2%, jungle 2%, mid 1%.
I have been filled into different roles, but never get autofilled because im a support main. so if you dont want to get autofilled, play support.

As someone who plays support when i am feeling more generous i can have supp as my main and fill as my secondary and still get jungle/bot over Support some times.

Sadly people see support as a free ride some times and just que up for it, or you get lucky/unlucky and a lot of supp mains are queuing up.
